channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump commutes sentence of former Rep. George Santos, who was serving 7 years for fraud and identity theft
item.description: “George Santos was somewhat of a ‘rogue,’ but there are many rogues throughout our Country that aren’t forced to serve seven years in prison."

item.title: What Sora’s Martin Luther King Jr. problem revealed to OpenAI
item.description: Martin Luther King Jr. did plenty to change the world for the better. And nearly 60 years after his assassination, he’s at the center of a major conce...

item.title: There’s a Right Way to Reject Job Applicants, and It Helps Your Long-Term Hiring Strategy
item.description: If you’re thoughtful when you say no, a near-miss job candidate may consider reapplying at your company for other positions.

item.title: Retro design is making a comeback in tech and home decor
item.description: It might start with a cassette deck that streams Spotify and charges your phone. It doesn’t have to stop there. These days, yesterday is big business....

item.title: Here’s How LinkedIn Co-Founder Reid Hoffman Says AI Needs to Be Regulated
item.description: Reid Hoffman spoke with Inc. on the heels of Demo Day in San Francisco, a pitch competition from Entrepreneurs First.

item.title: Rattled Wall Street on alert after trillion-dollar risk runup
item.description: Stocks still ended the week with a tidy gain, but six days of volatility across assets shows a deeper anxiety taking hold: credit fragility.

item.title: OpenAI pauses AI-generated deepfakes of Martin Luther King Jr. on Sora 2 app after ‘disrespectful’ depictions
item.description: “For me, many of the AI depictions never rose to the level of free speech,” Bernice A. King wrote on X. “They were foolishness.”

item.title: U.S. auto delinquencies have jumped 50% from 15 years ago
item.description: “Consumers now are in a more precarious position than they’ve been since the last recession,” said Rikard Bandebo, VantageScore’s chief economist.

item.title: Apple’s F1 Deal Includes Something I Didn’t Expect. It Makes Perfect Sense
item.description: The deal brings the world’s fastest-growing sport to Apple’s platforms—some of it for free.

item.title: Wealthy millennial, Gen Z Platinum members drive American Express to record revenue: ‘very comfortable paying for its exceptional value’
item.description: Platinum is morphing into "the premium lifestyle card," CEO Steve Squeri says. The market sent shares up more than 7% on the strength of the status sy...

item.title: Apple’s new deal with Formula One aims to grow U.S. audience
item.description: Formula One announced a five-year deal Friday with Apple , which will be the global motorsports series’ U.S. broadcast partner beginning next season. ...

item.title: Steal Citigroup’s AI Training Rule to Ensure Successful Adoption at Your Company
item.description: When it comes to deploying artificial intelligence at your business, take a lesson from the global bank’s approach.

item.title: Research Shows That Political Talk Is Tanking Workplace Harmony. Here’s How Leaders Can Fix It
item.description: A new survey shows a large majority of employees are uncomfortable with political discussions on the job and want them excluded from the workplace.
